io.o2mc.sdk

Class TrackingManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.o2mc.sdk.TrackingManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    O2MCExceptionNotifier

    public class TrackingManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements O2MCExceptionNotifier
    Acts as an intermediate between O2MC and our classes. This is useful to protect methods which are not supposed to be used by the implementing App, but which are required to be public for some function callbacks.

    Protecting functions from use by an implementing App prevents accidental usage of methods and therefore prevents incorrect usage of our SDK. Makes the SDK more easy to use and robust.

      • notifyException

        public void notifyException(O2MCException e,
                            boolean isFatal)
        Description copied from interface: O2MCExceptionNotifier
        Notifies the SDK user about an exception. This happens in a way the SDK user chose to do. If they've set an exception listener, notify by throwing an exception there. If they've not set an exception listener, log an error.
        Specified by:
        notifyException in interface O2MCExceptionNotifier
        Parameters:
        e - an exception with a message descriptive of what went wrong. Its type indicates at which subject the error occurred.
        isFatal - true if exception is fatal for base SDK functionality. SDK will then stop working.
